intro: Tephrosia geminiflora, commonly known as the twin-flower tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive floral structure. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. Tephrosia geminiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It is also valued for its potential medicinal properties and use in traditional herbal practices.
